message: I have a unique and valuable product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $12,000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better price anywhere else.

Thanks for the offer, Alice.  I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. While I value the product, $12,000 is a bit above my budget.  I'm prepared to offer $9,500.  I believe this is a fair price considering the value we both see in this product.  Let's see if we can find common ground.

I understand that $9,500 is a bit below your budget, Bob. However, I still believe the product is worth a premium price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $11,000. This is a fair price that balances the value you see in the product with the price you're willing to pay.

Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but $11,000 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $10,250, which is a good compromise and shows my seriousness about buying this product. Let's see if we can close this deal at this price.

I understand that you're willing to go up to $10,250, Bob, but I'm still not sure that's enough to justify the value of this product. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to the value I know this product holds. I'll offer it to you for $11,750. This is my final compromise, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.

Alice, I understand you're looking for a certain price, but $11,750 is still outside my comfort zone.  I'm willing to go up to $10,500. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the value of the product while staying within my budget. This is my final offer. Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Bob, but I'm not willing to go below $12,000. I've already made significant concessions, and I need to get closer to the value I know this product holds. I'll offer it to you for $12,000, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
